verses.verse: <S%H4905>Maschil<s%> of <S%H623>Asaph<s%>. O <S%H430>God<s%>, why hast thou cast us <S%H2186>off<s%> for <S%H5331>ever<s%>? why doth thine <S%H639>anger<s%> <S%H6225>smoke<s%> against the <S%H6629>sheep<s%> of thy <S%H4830>pasture<s%>? Maschil: or, A Psalm for Asaph to give instruction

<S%H2142>Remember<s%> thy <S%H5712>congregation<s%>, which thou hast <S%H7069>purchased<s%> of <S%H6924>old<s%>; the <S%H7626>rod<s%> of thine <S%H5159>inheritance<s%>, which thou hast <S%H1350>redeemed<s%>; this <S%H2022>mount<s%> <S%H6726>Zion<s%>, wherein thou hast <S%H7931>dwelt<s%>. rod: or, tribe
Lift <S%H7311>up<s%> thy <S%H6471>feet<s%> unto the <S%H5331>perpetual<s%> <S%H4876>desolations<s%>; even all that the <S%H341>enemy<s%> hath done <S%H7489>wickedly<s%> in the <S%H6944>sanctuary<s%>.
Thine <S%H6887>enemies<s%> <S%H7580>roar<s%> in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> of thy <S%H4150>congregations<s%>; they set <S%H7760>up<s%> their <S%H226>ensigns<s%> for <S%H226>signs<s%>.
A man was <S%H3045>famous<s%> according as he had lifted <S%H935>up<s%> <S%H4605><s%> <S%H7134>axes<s%> upon the <S%H5442>thick<s%> <S%H6086>trees<s%>.
But now they break <S%H1986>down<s%> the carved <S%H6603>work<s%> thereof at <S%H3162>once<s%> with <S%H3781>axes<s%> and <S%H3597>hammers<s%>.

They have <S%H7971>cast<s%> <S%H784>fire<s%> into thy <S%H4720>sanctuary<s%>, they have <S%H2490>defiled<s%> by casting down the dwelling <S%H4908>place<s%> of thy <S%H8034>name<s%> to the <S%H776>ground<s%>. They have cast: Heb. They have sent thy sanctuary unto the fire

They <S%H559>said<s%> in their <S%H3820>hearts<s%>, Let us <S%H3238>destroy<s%> them <S%H3162>together<s%>: they have burned <S%H8313>up<s%> all the <S%H4150>synagogues<s%> of <S%H410>God<s%> in the <S%H776>land<s%>. destroy: Heb. break
We <S%H7200>see<s%> not our <S%H226>signs<s%>: there is no more any <S%H5030>prophet<s%>: neither is there among us any that <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> how <S%H5704>long<s%>.
O <S%H430>God<s%>, how long shall the <S%H6862>adversary<s%> <S%H2778>reproach<s%>? shall the <S%H341>enemy<s%> <S%H5006>blaspheme<s%> thy <S%H8034>name<s%> for <S%H5331>ever<s%>?
Why <S%H7725>withdrawest<s%> thou thy <S%H3027>hand<s%>, even thy right <S%H3225>hand<s%>? <S%H3615>pluck<s%> it out <S%H7130>of<s%> thy <S%H2436>bosom<s%> <S%H2436><s%>.
For <S%H430>God<s%> is my <S%H4428>King<s%> of <S%H6924>old<s%>, <S%H6466>working<s%> <S%H3444>salvation<s%> in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>.

Thou didst <S%H6565>divide<s%> the <S%H3220>sea<s%> by thy <S%H5797>strength<s%>: thou <S%H7665>brakest<s%> the <S%H7218>heads<s%> of the <S%H8577>dragons<s%> in the <S%H4325>waters<s%>. divide: Heb. break dragons: or, whales

Thou <S%H7533>brakest<s%> the <S%H7218>heads<s%> of <S%H3882>leviathan<s%> in pieces, and <S%H5414>gavest<s%> him to be <S%H3978>meat<s%> to the <S%H5971>people<s%> inhabiting the <S%H6728>wilderness<s%>.
Thou didst <S%H1234>cleave<s%> the <S%H4599>fountain<s%> and the <S%H5158>flood<s%>: thou driedst <S%H3001>up<s%> <S%H386>mighty<s%> <S%H5104>rivers<s%>. mighty: Heb. rivers of strength
The <S%H3117>day<s%> is thine, the <S%H3915>night<s%> also is thine: thou hast <S%H3559>prepared<s%> the <S%H3974>light<s%> and the <S%H8121>sun<s%>.
Thou hast <S%H5324>set<s%> all the <S%H1367>borders<s%> of the <S%H776>earth<s%>: thou hast <S%H3335>made<s%> <S%H7019>summer<s%> and <S%H2779>winter<s%>. made: Heb. made them

<S%H2142>Remember<s%> this, that the <S%H341>enemy<s%> hath <S%H2778>reproached<s%>, O <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, and that the <S%H5036>foolish<s%> <S%H5971>people<s%> have <S%H5006>blasphemed<s%> thy <S%H8034>name<s%>.

O <S%H5414>deliver<s%> not the <S%H5315>soul<s%> of thy <S%H8449>turtledove<s%> unto the <S%H2416>multitude<s%> of the wicked: <S%H7911>forget<s%> not the <S%H2416>congregation<s%> of thy <S%H6041>poor<s%> for <S%H5331>ever<s%>.
Have <S%H5027>respect<s%> unto the <S%H1285>covenant<s%>: for the <S%H4285>dark<s%> places of the <S%H776>earth<s%> are <S%H4390>full<s%> of the <S%H4999>habitations<s%> of <S%H2555>cruelty<s%>.
O let not the <S%H1790>oppressed<s%> <S%H7725>return<s%> <S%H3637>ashamed<s%>: let the <S%H6041>poor<s%> and <S%H34>needy<s%> <S%H1984>praise<s%> thy <S%H8034>name<s%>.
<S%H6965>Arise<s%>, O <S%H430>God<s%>, <S%H7378>plead<s%> thine own <S%H7379>cause<s%>: <S%H2142>remember<s%> how the foolish <S%H5036>man<s%> <S%H2781>reproacheth<s%> thee <S%H3117>daily<s%>.

<S%H7911>Forget<s%> not the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of thine <S%H6887>enemies<s%>: the <S%H7588>tumult<s%> of those that rise <S%H6965>up<s%> against thee <S%H5927>increaseth<s%> <S%H8548>continually<s%>. increaseth: Heb. ascendeth
